definition: Exaggerating the importance of negative events.
example: The evening will be a disaster.

definition: Thinking that an inherently continuous situation can only fall into two categories.
example: No one will ever like me.
OK but my grade was not that good.

definition: Thinking that something is true based on how one feels, ignoring the evidence to the contrary.
example: My grades are good but it still feels like I will fail.

definition: Making predictions, usually negative ones, about the future.
example: Whatever I try I will not be successful.

definition: Labeling yourself or others while discounting evidence that could lead to less disastrous conclusions.
Magnifying negative aspects or minimizing positive aspects.
example: My good grades are really not important.

definition: Paying too much attention to negative details instead of the whole picture.
example: If I only worked harder, I would be more successful.

definition: Believing you know what others are thinking.
example: Everyone believes I am a failure.

definition: Making sweeping negative conclusions based on a few examples.
Believing others are behaving negatively because of oneself, without considering more plausible or external explanations for behavior.
example: Everyone thinks I am a loser for calling her.

definition: Having a fixed idea on how you and/or others should behave.
example: I have to do this or I will not make it to the weekend.
